article.title: German Navy To Receive Northrop Grumman Radar Systems
article.author: Henry Kenyon
article.text: Northrop Grumman Corporation's Naval and Marine Systems Division has received a contract to supply new radar systems for German navy ships. The contract, let by the German navy procurement authority,Â is a follow-on to the completed four-year, $4.3 million program under which Northrop Grumman replaced radars on 70 German navy ships with Sperry Marine BridgeMaster E radar sets. The company will supply its new-generation Sperry Marine VisionMaster FT radar systems on 10 additional German navy ships, two of which will be fitted with dual-channel radar technology.
